com.github.naoghuman.lib.i18n.internal

Class DefaultI18NValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.naoghuman.lib.i18n.internal.DefaultI18NValidator

  • public final class DefaultI18NValidator
extends Object
    An implementation from different validation methods to check preconditions in the topic from this library Lib-I18N.
    Since:
    0.1.0-PRERELEASE
    Version:
    0.6.1
    Author:
    Naoghuman

    • Method Detail

      • isNull

        public static boolean isNull(Object obj)
        Delegates to Objects.isNull(java.lang.Object).

        This method exists to be used as a Predicate, filter(Objects::isNull).

        Parameters:
        obj - a reference which will be checked against NULL.
        Returns:
        TRUE if the provided reference is NULL otherwise FALSE.
        Since:
        0.1.0-PRERELEASE
        See Also:
        Predicate

      • nonNull

        public static boolean nonNull(Object obj)
        Delegates to Objects.nonNull(java.lang.Object).

        This method exists to be used as a Predicate, filter(Objects::nonNull).

        Parameters:
        obj - a reference which will be checked against NULL.
        Returns:
        TRUE if the provided reference is NON-NULL otherwise FALSE.
        Since:
        0.1.0-PRERELEASE
        See Also:
        Predicate

      • requireNonNull

        public static <T> void requireNonNull(T value)
                               throws NullPointerException
        Validates if the attribute value isn't NULL.

        An additional error message will be added to the error stack:

        • The attribute [value] can't be NULL.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the reference.
        Parameters:
        value - the attribute which should be validated.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if (value == NULL).
        Since:
        0.1.0-PRERELEASE

      • requireNonNullAndNotEmpty

        public static void requireNonNullAndNotEmpty(String value)
                                      throws NullPointerException,
                                             IllegalArgumentException
        Validates if the attribute value isn't NULL and not EMPTY.

        Adds following additional error messages depending from the error to the error stack:

        • The attribute [value] can't be NULL.
        • The attribute [value] can't be EMPTY.
        Parameters:
        value - the attribute which should be validated.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if (value == NULL).
        IllegalArgumentException - if (value.trim() == EMPTY).
        Since:
        0.1.0-PRERELEASE

      • requireNonNullAndNotEmpty

        public static void requireNonNullAndNotEmpty(Object... elements)
                                      throws NullPointerException,
                                             IllegalArgumentException
        Validates if the attribute elements isn't NULL and not EMPTY.

        Adds following additional error messages depending from the error to the error stack:

        • The attribute [elements] can't be NULL.
        • The attribute [elements] can't be EMPTY.
        Parameters:
        elements - the attribute which should be validated.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if (elements == NULL).
        IllegalArgumentException - if (elements == EMPTY).
        Since:
        0.1.0-PRERELEASE

      • requireNonNullAndNotEmpty

        public static <T> void requireNonNullAndNotEmpty(javafx.collections.ObservableList<T> elements)
                                          throws NullPointerException,
                                                 IllegalArgumentException
        Validates if the attribute elements isn't NULL and not EMPTY.

        Adds following additional error messages depending from the error to the error stack:

        • The attribute [elements] can't be NULL.
        • The attribute [elements] can't be EMPTY.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the reference.
        Parameters:
        elements - the attribute which should be validated.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if (elements == NULL).
        IllegalArgumentException - if (elements == EMPTY).
        Since:
        0.1.0-PRERELEASE

      • requireResourceBundleExist

        public static void requireResourceBundleExist(String baseBundleName,
                                              Locale actualLocale)
        Checks if a ResourceBundle with the given parameters can be loaded.

        If the ResourceBundle can't be found a MissingResourceException will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        baseBundleName - which should be used to load the ResourceBundle.
        actualLocale - which should be used to load the ResourceBundle.
        Since:
        0.7.0
        See Also:
        MissingResourceException, ResourceBundle
